metadata.title: CVE-2013-4407 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium
metadata.description:
HTTP::Body::Multipart in the HTTP-Body 1.08, 1.17, and earlier module forPerl uses the part of the uploaded file's name after the first "."character as the suffix of a temporary file, which makes it easier forremote attackers to conduct attacks by leveraging subsequent behavior thatmay assume the suffix is well-formed.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2013-4407` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libhttp-body-perl - 1.19-1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: libhttp-body-perl package in trusty, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1.19-1').
